java.lang

Class Throwable

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Exception

    public class Throwable
extends Object
    The Throwable class is the superclass of all errors and exceptions in the Java Card platform's subset of the Java programming language. Only objects that are instances of this class (or of one of its subclasses) are thrown by the Java Card Virtual Machine or can be thrown by the Java programming language throw statement. Similarly, only this class or one of its subclasses can be the argument type in a catch clause.

    This Java Card platform class's functionality is a strict subset of the definition in the JavaTM Platform Standard Edition (Java SETM) API Specification.
